title: Tutorial: creating a document from html

title: Tutorial: creating a document from html
text: rspacer package example file. RStudio, go File > New File > R Markdown. moment (2025-02-06) yet option create Quarto files template, chose provide file R Markdown template. left, click Template. Choose rspacer Template example. Save file Quarto file (.qmd). Render file html report. Alternatively, can create new Quarto document. Include headers RSpace Template previously created, make sure headers two hashtags (h2 headers, ##). can write code, use h3 h4 headers (three four hashtags), long h2 headers identical structured document template.

what: Specify the file name of the file to upload

text: rspacer needs know file want upload. tutorial, want create structured document file Template_example.html created , want upload .qmd file attachment. recommend work relative paths within R project (can specify using package. want, need specify absolute file path. code assumes html file qmd file filename. case, change file_name matching_code_file variables.

title: Tutorial: creating a document from html
text: upload document attachment API inbox, code chunk sufficient: However, document_create_from_html() parameters, case want , example, upload file specific folder replace existing document (click function learn ). find values parameters? Browse RSpace folders using folder_tree() use either id globalID. Folder identifiers start FL, notebook identifiers start NB, structured document identifiers start SD. example: course can also find going web interface RSpace instance. can also tag documents using tags vector, example status like “finished” “progress” “failed”. Finally, can upload attachments, need specified using list lists, field number path file needs attached field. example also upload source .qmd file provided .

title: Tutorial: creating a document from a tabular file
text: Open Excel create csv file run code chunk create small example file. two columns. first one fields exactly template. second column content field correct format. use Excel, make sure dates saved string format dd-mm-yyyy.
code: (file_name <- "Template_example.csv") ## [1] "Template_example.csv" data.frame(   name = c("Title", "Date", "Main part", "Conclusion"),   content = c("example title", "23-12-2024", "This is example text.",               "ready for uploading.") ) |>   write_csv(file_name, col_names = FALSE)

text: upload document API inbox, code chunk sufficient returns created document. creates document Template_example.csv. function works CSV, TSV XLSX file formats. Make sure template_id identifier template previously made RSpace. function document_create_from_tabfile() parameters, example upload document specified notebook folder (click function learn ). find values parameters? Browse RSpace folders using folder_tree() use either id globalID. Folder identifiers start FL, notebook identifiers start NB, structured document identifiers start SD. example: course can also find going web interface RSpace instance. can also tag documents using tags vector, example status like “finished” “progress” “failed”. want upload attachments field, use attachments argument. Files added number field attachment. can optionally replace existing Document specifying existing_file_id. Use file needs replaced instead created. example add Quarto code file HTML file Template_example.html attachment field number 4. also place file specific folder, add “tutorial” tag.

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: use rspacer needs know two things: API URL RSpace instance (typically URL RSpace instance followed api/v1, e.g. https://leiden.researchspace.com/api/v1) API key, authentication token can use instead username password. create API key go ‘Manage API Key’ section RSpace profile page (MyRSpace -> Profile). keep API key private. can regenerate API key time, invalidate old key. can use set_api_url() set_api_key() functions make available rspacer current session. make information persistent can store environment variables. easy way usethis::edit_r_environ(); file opens, add following lines (insert URL key): saving file restarting R, now able run

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: Now can use rspacer interact RSpace Workspace. example, folder_tree() show content Workspace tibble: can also specify id Unique ID (globalId) show contents specific folder:
code: folder_tree() ## # A tibble: 10 × 9 ##        id globalId name                   created          lastModified parentFolderId type  `_links` owner        ##     <int> <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>            <chr>                 <int> <chr> <list>   <list>       ## title: Introduction to rspacer
text: can retrieve documents using result json converted R list, get field information use
code:
res <- document_retrieve("SD356307") summary(res) ## Length Class Mode ## id 1 -none- numeric ## globalId 1 -none- character ## name 1 -none- character ## created 1 -none- character ## lastModified 1 -none- character ## parentFolderId 1 -none- numeric ## signed 1 -none- logical ## tags 0 -none- NULL ## tagMetaData 0 -none- NULL ## form 10 -none- list ## owner 10 -none- list ## fields 8 -none- list ## _links 1 -none- list library(tidyverse) tibble(fields = res$fields) |> unnest_wider(fields) |> select(name, type, content) ## # A tibble: 8 × 3 ## name type content ## ## 1 Template Used string "LACDR-ISA - Contact v0.2.0" ## 2 Name string "Gerhard A. Burger" ## 3 Email string "g.a.burger@lacdr.leidenuniv.nl" ## 4 Phone string "" ## 5 ORCID string "0000-0003-1062-5576" ## 6 Address text "

Gorlaeus … ## 7 Affiliation string "Leiden University" ## 8 Roles text ""

title: RSpace API Wrapper
text: goal rspacer wrap RSpace API, , allow use API directly R using convenience functions.

text: See Get started article use package. NB: API Paging/rate limiting properly handled yet, can worked around.

text: JSON object, invisibly. function raise error doc_id specified.

what: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: Append html document (e.g., generated quarto) RSpace structured document. function retrieves current document, adds text fields specified h2 html headers.

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
code: document_append_from_html(   path,   existing_document_id,   tags = NULL,   attachments = NULL,   allow_missing_fields = FALSE,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: path html document upload existing_document_id document identifier current RSpace document. tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") allow_missing_fields Specify mismatch fields allowed. FALSE, html fields appended RSpace document fields missing. TRUE, fields name template appended. api_key RSpace API key

what: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
text: function can upload html document (e.g., generated quarto) RSpace Basic Document, Structured Document template also provided.

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
code: document_create_from_html(   path,   template_id = NULL,   folder_id = NULL,   tags = NULL,   attachments = NULL,   existing_document_id = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
text: path html document upload template_id document id RSpace template used. overwritten template existing_document_id specified. basic document created template specified. folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") existing_document_id document id document replaced, NULL (default) new document created. api_key RSpace API key

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
text: Invisible JSON response API.

what: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile
title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile
text: function can upload tabular files RSpace structured documents. file needs exactly two columns, one RSpace structured document fields one content.

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile
code: document_create_from_tabfile(   path,   file_type = NULL,   document_name = NULL,   template_id = NULL,   folder_id = NULL,   tags = NULL,   attachments = NULL,   existing_document_id = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile
text: path tabular file upload. Can XLSX, CSV TSV file_type optional character string specify file type. guessed file name specified. document_name specify name RSpace entry. specified, value Title, Name, title, name one fields Excel document. exist, file name. template_id document id RSpace template used. overwritten template existing_document_id specified. basic document created template specified. folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") existing_document_id document id document replaced, NULL (default) new document created. api_key RSpace API key

text: doc_id Unique identifier document field_id Specify either field_id field_name. Identifier fields attachments listed. identifier relative, example 1 top field, 2 second field, etc. unique field identifier. field_name Specify either field_id field_name. field name attachments need listed. api_key RSpace API key

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: set environment variable current session, set permanently, add RSPACE_API_KEY=<your_api_key_here> .Renviron file, example, using usethis::edit_r_environ().

what: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
title: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
text: Sets RSPACE_API_URL environment variable provided RSpace API URL. RSpace API URL likely URL RSpace instance followed api/v1.

title: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
text: rspace_api_url RSpace API URL

title: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
text: set environment variable current session, set permanently, add RSPACE_API_URL=<your_api_url_here> .Renviron file, example, using usethis::edit_r_environ().

title: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
